condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2022, the most vulnerable boys and girls as well as their mother and other community members use essential nutrition services and have increased understanding and resilient practices of good nutrition behaviors, with a focus on the first 1,000 days, including in humanitarian programming environments.

description.narrative: In 2019, a total of 266,780 children under five (including those affected by drought-like conditions in Sindh and Balochistan) accessed quality treatment for severe acute malnutrition. UNICEF facilitated two rounds of vitamin A supplementation, reaching 36 million children aged 6–59 months in the second round. The 300 nutrition assistants trained on the parenting package, who reached 90,000 mothers and 20,000 fathers, offer an opportunity for community-based implementation of early childhood care practices. Through community-based engagement and media campaigns, appropriate information on infant and young child feeding practices reached over 75 million people. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
